trans-unit.source: Get Started with Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs; sending events in C# and receiving them in an Apache Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs; sending events in C# and receiving them in an Apache Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second, enabling an application to process and analyze the massive amounts of data produced by your connected devices and applications.
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second, enabling an application to process and analyze the massive amounts of data produced by your connected devices and applications.

trans-unit.source: Once collected into Event Hubs, you can transform and store data using any real-time analytics provider or storage cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once collected into Event Hubs, you can transform and store data using any real-time analytics provider or storage cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see the [Event Hubs overview].
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see the [Event Hubs overview].

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will learn how to ingest messages into an Event Hub using a console application in C#, and to retrieve them in parallel using Apache Storm.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will learn how to ingest messages into an Event Hub using a console application in C#, and to retrieve them in parallel using Apache Storm.

trans-unit.source: In order to complete this tutorial you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: In order to complete this tutorial you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows

trans-unit.source: A Java development environment configured to run <linkText>Maven</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A Java development environment configured to run <linkText>Maven</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we will assume <linkText>Eclipse</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we will assume <linkText>Eclipse</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on App Services, then Service Bus, then Event Hub, then Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on App Services, then Service Bus, then Event Hub, then Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your Event Hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your Event Hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace you just created (usually *event hub name*-ns).
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace you just created (usually *event hub name*-ns).

trans-unit.source: Click the Event Hubs tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the Event Hubs tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab at the top, add a rule named SendRule with Send rights, add another rule called ReceiveRule with Listen rights, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab at the top, add a rule named SendRule with Send rights, add another rule called ReceiveRule with Listen rights, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the same page, take note of the generated keys for ReceiveRule.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, take note of the generated keys for ReceiveRule.

trans-unit.source: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click Connection Information.
trans-unit.target: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click Connection Information.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.
trans-unit.target: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.

trans-unit.source: Now you are ready to run the applications.
trans-unit.target: Now you are ready to run the applications.

trans-unit.source: Run the LogTopology class from Eclipse, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.
trans-unit.target: Run the LogTopology class from Eclipse, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.

trans-unit.source: Run the Sender project, press Enter in the console window, and see the events appear in the receiver window.
trans-unit.target: Run the Sender project, press Enter in the console window, and see the events appear in the receiver window.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've built a working application that creates an Event Hub and sends and receives data, you can move on to the following scenarios:
trans-unit.target: Now that you've built a working application that creates an Event Hub and sends and receives data, you can move on to the following scenarios:

trans-unit.source: A complete [sample application that uses Event Hubs].
trans-unit.target: A complete [sample application that uses Event Hubs].

trans-unit.source: The [Scale out Event Processing with Event Hubs] sample.
trans-unit.target: The [Scale out Event Processing with Event Hubs] sample.

trans-unit.source: A [queued messaging solution] using Service Bus queues.
trans-unit.target: A [queued messaging solution] using Service Bus queues.
